title: Let Amazon know what ads you see and it will give you money
description: Those on Amazon’s rewards program can let the retailer see how you you interact with ads

title: Microsoft is reportedly planning a one-stop "super app" for all your needs
description: Rumors claim Microsoft is considering a single app for communications, shopping, and news.

title: Instagram will finally help creators understand why they're failing
description: As a part of updating the platform's Account Status tool, Instagram also aims to improve transparency

title: Hackers are using Telegram to target crypto firms
description: Crypto exchange VIP customers targeted with weaponized Excel files.

title: Intel Sapphire Rapids chips confirmed to be supercharging your next workstation
description: Intel Sapphire Rapids chips officially set to be introduced on upcoming workstations.

title: Vivaldi is adding Mastodon to its browser
description: Mastodon integration and usability enhancements are announced as part of an update to the Vivaldi browser.

title: Another Witcher game just got axed, but there's time to say goodbye
description: As another Witcher game goes to ground, let's hope the devs bring the goods in 2023

title: Microsoft Teams will finally be a lot easier to use on iPad and iPhone
description: Get a productivity boost with Picture in Picture for Microsoft Teams on iPhone and iPad.

title: Ubisoft wants to help you be a less toxic gamer
description: The anti-bullying courses seek to “educate players and prevent toxicity before it happens.”

title: Amazon joins Open Invention Network to keep its Linux patents safe
description: Amazon joins Open Invention Network (OIN) patent non-aggression consortium.

title: Nearly all businesses are adopting Zero Trust, but still aren't getting its full business potential
description: Zero Trust security protocols have a lot to offer, but most businesses don't feel the urgency to switch.

title: The Rings of Power season 2 forges eight cast members in the fires of Mount Doom
description: Amazon has announced eight new actors have joined its Lord of the Rings TV series' cast for its second season.

title: OLED TV glow-up: brighter, more efficient panels are coming – but you'll have to wait
description: Component maker Universal Display says its new emitter tech could improve panels by up to 75% – but there’s a two-year wait.

title: Millions of people have had their data sold on bot markets
description: Data batches for $6 per person, with around five million users thought to have been affected.

title: Many SMBs still just aren't equipped to deal with cyberattacks
description: A lack of qualified staff and budget are also named as issues.

title: The reason Cyberpunk 2077's multiplayer spinoff didn't happen is kind of obvious
description: Cyberpunk devs blame the scrapped multiplayer mode on issues with the base game – but could it be resurrected?

title: Oppo Find N2: what we know so far
description: The Oppo Find N2 and Find N2 Flip foldables could land before the end of the year, and we've heard a lot about them.

title: Get Disney Plus for cheap before its massive price hike tomorrow
description: Disney Plus with ads is almost here along with a price hike for the ad-free tier, here's how to lock in a cheaper price for a little longer.

title: GTA Online update adds major graphics feature to PS5 and Xbox Series X
description: An upcoming patch for GTA Online will add ray-traced reflections and more to the popular multiplayer mode.

title: It just got a lot easier to find the best custom maps and modes in Halo Infinite
description: Halo’s PvP multiplayer mode is back, and with it an easier way to find and play custom player-made maps and modes.

title: AMD could have Nvidia scared enough to revive the RTX 4080... as the RTX 4070 Ti
description: The RTX 4070 Ti has surfaced online, and it sure does look exactly the same as the canceled RTX 4080 12GB.

title: Amnesty International branch hit by suspected Chinese hackers
description: Chinese state-sponsored attackers have been snooping around again, but there's no evidence of data exfiltration.

title: 'Never doubt James Cameron': Avatar 2 first critical reactions call it a 'visual masterpiece'
description: Avatar: The Way of Water's early reactions are in – and critics are falling over themselves to lavish praise on the sci-fi sequel.

title: Facebook Dating will use your face to verify you're old enough to date
description: Just like on Instagram, Facebook Dating will ask users to make certain poses to determine if you're an adult.

title: Give the gift of a non-cracked iPhone this holiday season
description: Ensure your favorite outdoor adventurer can protect their new iPhone this Christmas with Rokform.
